basis: No actual eating action was recorded in the session; user expressed intent to try tonight, so action is planned rather than executed.
cognitive_dissonance: No explicit internal conflict; user recognizes stress but commits to trying the micro-action.
negative_thought_patterns: No explicit negative self-talk; mild stress acknowledgment; no evident hopelessness or all-or-nothing reasoning.
emotional_triggers: Acute stress and possible dinner-time expectations; stress appears to influence eating behavior but user seeks structure to cope.
coaching_notes: Maintain a supportive, concise tone; emphasize micro-actions and quick check-ins. In next session, verify whether the snack was attempted, discuss barriers if not, and reinforce stress-management strategies and flexible planning.
